channel.title: BBC News | News Front Page | World Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Ferry sinks in Red Sea
item.description: A ferry carrying about 1,400 people has sunk in the Red Sea, off the Egyptian coast. Bodies and survivors are being pulled from the water but the weather is hampering rescue efforts.

item.title: Muslims in new cartoon protests
item.description: Fresh protests are being made over the publication of cartoons depicting the Prophet Muhammad.

item.title: Taleban clash 'leaves many dead'
item.description: Nearly 20 people are killed in fighting between troops and Taleban in Helmand province in Afghanistan, officials say.

item.title: Iran set to face Security Council
item.description: The UN's atomic watchdog will report Iran to the Security Council when it reconvenes in Vienna, diplomats say.

item.title: Kenya gold scam report delivered
item.description: A report into Kenya's multi-million dollar gold and diamond scam is handed over to President Mwai Kibaki.

item.title: More Dutch troops for Afghanistan
item.description: The Dutch parliament approves a plan to send an extra 1,400 troops to Afghanistan.

item.title: Japan minister urges royal debate
item.description: Japan's foreign minister questions plans to let females succeed to the throne, the first Cabinet member to do so.

item.title: France deports African 'rioter'
item.description: France says it has deported a Malian man, in the first expulsion of a foreigner over the November urban riots.

item.title: Mussolini's jazz pianist son dies
item.description: Romano Mussolini, a son of Italy's former fascist dictator, dies in Rome aged 79 after a successful jazz career.

item.title: Nigeria's Christians back Muslims
item.description: A Nigerian Christian body condemns the publication of cartoons depicting the Prophet Muhammad.

item.title: US House Republicans pick leader
item.description: US House of Representatives Republicans elect John Boehner as their leader, after their ex-chief had to quit.

item.title: Venezuela expels US naval 'spy'
item.description: Venezuelan leader Hugo Chavez says he is expelling a US official accused of spying with Venezuelan officers.

item.title: Minister quits over Thaksin deal
item.description: A Thai Cabinet minister resigns over a controversial share sale by PM Thaksin Shinawatra's family.

item.title: Jakarta joins cartoon protests
item.description: Protests over the publication of cartoons depicting the Prophet Muhammad reach Indonesia.

item.title: Editor convicted for Chechen text
item.description: The editor of a US-funded newspaper in Russia is found guilty of inciting ethnic hatred over Chechnya.

item.title: Madrid backs Gas Natural takeover
item.description: The Spanish government gives final approval to Gas Natural's hostile 22.4bn takeover bid for fellow Spanish firm Endesa.

item.title: Rocket attack on Israeli kibbutz
item.description: A rocket attack in southern Israel injures three, as Israeli forces clash with Hezbollah guerrillas in Lebanon.

item.title: Palestinian men seized with bombs
item.description: Israeli forces arrest two Palestinians carrying explosive belts at a checkpoint near Nablus, the Israeli army says.

item.title: Musharraf in cartoon condemnation
item.description: Pakistani President Pervez Musharraf strongly condemns the publication of cartoons depicting the Prophet.

item.title: 'Crackdown' ahead of Dhaka rally
item.description: Bangladesh's opposition parties say 1,000 of its activists are detained ahead of an anti-government rally.

item.title: Straw condemns cartoon row press
item.description: Jack Straw attacks European papers for reprinting a cartoon of the Prophet Muhammad, but praises UK media.

item.title: US jobs growth less than forecast
item.description: The US economy added 193,000 jobs in January, while consumer sentiment dipped slightly.

item.title: Cocaine stomach problem warning
item.description: Cocaine users are at risk of life-threatening stomach problems, doctors have warned.

item.title: Infertility link in iceman's DNA
item.description: Oetzi, the prehistoric man frozen in a glacier for 5,000 years, could have been infertile, new research on his genes suggests.

item.title: 'Limited' damage from Nyxem virus
item.description: Early warnings about the destructive Nyxem virus have headed off widespread damage, say experts.

item.title: Three Irish music awards for U2
item.description: Irish rockers U2 win three prizes at the Meteor Ireland Music Awards, held in their home town of Dublin.

item.title: Football: Guinea 2-3 Senegal
item.description: Senegal come from behind to beat Guinea 3-2 and reach the semi-finals at the African Cup of Nations.

item.title: Cricket: Aussies record easy win
item.description: Brett Lee takes 4-21 as South Africa slump to an 80-run defeat against Australia in the VB Series.
